subject: Productivity
title: Feedback Loops and Goals
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Feedback Loops and Goals.

hook.text: A goal without feedback is like driving blindfolded. You're moving, but you have no idea where.

buildup.text: Locke and Latham showed that goals plus feedback outperform goals alone by a significant margin.

discovery.text: Feedback tells you the gap between where you are and where you want to be. That gap fuels effort.

twist.text: The best feedback is frequent and specific. Annual reviews come too late to change behavior.

climax.text: Modern apps, dashboards, and trackers work because they close the feedback loop in real time.

punchline.text: Goals tell you where to go. Feedback tells you if you're getting there.

quiz.question: Why is feedback essential for goal achievement?
options: It reveals the gap between current state and the goal
It only matters for annual reviews
